text.content:
USING A TRICK

Each trick may be used as an action during a conflict if you have a set of wheels equipped, and either produces or costs momentum. You cannot use a trick if it would bring your Momentum Clock to higher than 8 or lower than 0.

THE MOMENTUM CLOCK

When you first learn a trick, either through acquiring the Skate Tricks or by equipping a set of

wheels you acquired through the Wheels skills, you receive a Momentum Clock.

❖ Your Momentum Clock has 8 sections, and begins each scene empty.

❖ When you use a trick, you will fill or erase sections of the clock depending on the Momentum of the trick. Filling if an increase and erasing if a decrease (you do so before the effects of the trick have been calculated and applied).

❖ Your Momentum Clock will provide a value called Momentum used when determining the effects of your tricks. Your MV is equal to the number of filled sections of your Momentum Clock, and your HV is equal to half of that number, rounded down.

❖ The effects of the Momentum Clock only apply during conflict, and will apply passive positive and negative effects to you based on its number of filled sections.

❖ Sections of your Momentum Clock may not be filled or erased in any way other than through the use of tricks, or through opportunities used by you.

@ICON[skill]

EFFECT

1

No effect.

2-3

You have +1 Defense.

4-5

You have +2 Defense and -1 penalty to Accuracyand Magic Checks.

6-7

You have +3 Defense and -2 penalty to Accuracy and Magic Checks.

8

You have +4 Defense and -3 penalty to Accuracyand Magic Checks.

Wheels

When you first take the Wheels skill, you learn to ride one of three kinds of wheels, a special item that can be equipped as an accessory. You can only do so if you’ve taken their basic benefits.

Sets of Wheels have a base cost of 300 zenit. Rare versions of the accessory can be found that possess qualities, as described in the Core Rulebook.

Two wheels held together by a frame, with a set of handlebars, and a seat for the rider.

While you have a Bike equipped, your distance traveled per day is multiplied by 2, and you cannot have anything equipped in your off-hand. The following tricks are known based on what benefits you have in this wheel. You must have a Bike equipped to use these tricks.

Trick

 Momentum

BASIC: Aerodynamic Blitz

-1

Make two free attacks. These attacks replace their HR with your MV.

Trick

 Momentum

ADVANCED: Sylvan Hopscotch

-2

Make a free attack with multi (HV). This attack deals your choice of air or earth damage, and you regain 5 MP for each creature hit.

Trick

 Momentum

SUPERIOR: Soaring Dragon

-4

If you are in crisis, nothing happens. If not, you become flying until the beginning of your next

turn. See page 307 of the Core Rulebook for the detailed effects of flying. At the start of your

next turn, if you have not suffered damage that you were vulnerable to or entered crisis, you

must use your action to attack. This can target flying creatures. This attack deals 20 extra

damage, and its damage becomes fire.

A board with two sets of trucks attaching four wheels to the bottom, stood on to ride.

While you have a Board equipped, you gain a +2 to all Opposed Checks that rely on mobility in a closely urban environment, such as a junkyard, city street, or set of ruins. The following tricks are known based on what benefits you have in this wheel. You must have a Board equipped to use these tricks.

Trick

 Momentum

BASIC: Arcanists Ollie

+1

You gain +2 to your next Magic Check.

Trick

 Momentum

ADVANCED: Tribulant Tailslide

-1

The next time you are hit with a melee attack, the attacker suffers the same damage you took.

Trick

 Momentum

SUPERIOR: X-Degree Leviathan

-X

Make a number of free attacks equal to your X (the amount of Momentum you chose to spend on this trick)against a single creature. These attacks deal ice damage and treat their HR as 0.

A pair of special boots with wheels on the bottom, allowing the wearer to skate upon the ground.

While you have Blades equipped, you enter conflict scenes where you were the leader or succeeded your Support Check, with two sections of your Momentum Clock filled. The following tricks are known based on what benefits you have in this wheel. You must have a Blades equipped to use these tricks.

Trick

 Momentum

BASIC: Thorn Dagger Spin

-2

Make two free attacks. These attacks replace their HR with your MV.

Trick

 Momentum

BASIC: Thorn Dagger Spin

-1

Choose an ally you can see. They gain a bonus equal to your current HV to their next check.

Trick

 Momentum

BASIC: Thorn Dagger Spin

-1

Every ally of your choice that you can see recovers HP and MP equal to 2 × MV. You can immediately use another (different) trick.

Trick

 Momentum

Cold Shoulder

-2

Creatures that hit you with a melee attack before the end of your next turn suffer 5 ice damage (after the attack has been resolved). This amount increases by 5 damage if you are level 20 or higher, or by 10 damage if you are level 40 or higher.

Trick

 Momentum

Dragon Tail Whip

-2

Make a free attack. That attack gains multi (HV).

Trick

 Momentum

Electric Backslide

-1

Any creatures that hit you with a melee attack since the beginning of this round become dazed.

Trick

 Momentum

Enigma Manual

+1

You recover 2 × MV mind points. This increases to 3 if you are level 20 or higher, or by 4 if you are level 40 or higher.

Trick

 Momentum

Gravitational Grab

+1

You become flying until the end of your next turn. See page 307 of the Core Rulebook for the detailed effects of flying.

Trick

 Momentum

Inferno Kick

-1

Make a free attack. That attack deals fire and deals 5 extra damage. This amount increases by 5 damage if you are level 20 or higher, or by 10 damage if you are level 40 or higher.

Trick

 Momentum

Mystic Grind

+2

Replace your Defense increase you would gain from your Momentum with an equal M. Defense increase until the end of your next turn.

Trick

 Momentum

Starfall Spin

+2

Choose a creature you can see that has flying. Make an opposed 【DEX + WLP】 against the target, who uses the same attributes. If you win, the target loses its flying skill until the end of your next turn. If you lose, they make a free attack against you, treating their HR as 0.
